AttributeDefinition.description: Vivir en su casa dentro del sector sanitario
Firmar el consentimiento por escrito para participar en el estudio
Residentes en un asilo de ancianos
Alto riesgo de deterioro clínico severo no tratable en el hogar, evaluado por el mejor criterio médico
Admisión en una unidad de corta estancia
Personal insuficiente en el equipo profesional que ejecuta el programa
Infarto de Miocardio (se excluye cambios EKG sin antecedentes médicos)
Enfermedad Vascular Periférica ( incluye Aneurisma de Aorta 6 cm )
Hepatopatía Leve ( sin hipertensión portal incluye hepatitis crónica)
Diabetes mellitus sin evidencia de afectación de órganos diana
Diabetes con afectación de órganos dianas (retinopatía,nefropatía etc)
Tumor sin metástasis ( excluir si > 5 años desde el diagnostico)

DerivedAttributeDefinition.expression: number(ch1,0) + number(ch2,0) + number(ch3,0) + number(ch4,0) + number(ch5,0) + number(ch6,0) + number(ch7,0) + number(ch8,0) + number(ch9,0) + number(ch10,0) + number(ch11,0)*2 + number(ch12,0)*2 + number(ch13,0)*2 + number(ch14,0)*2 + number(ch15,0)*2 + number(ch16,0)*2 + number(ch17,0)*3 + number(ch18,0)*6 + number(ch19,0)*6 + number(ch20,0)

EnumerationOption.description: necesita ayuda para cortar, extender la mantequilla, o requirere dieta modificada
independiente (lavado de cara, cepillado de dientes, afeitada). Los implementes pueden ser provistos por otra persona
necesita ayuda pero puede realizar al menos la mitad de las tareas
incontinent (incluye administración de enemas o supositoris)
incontinente, incluye pacientes con sonda incapaces de manejarse
necesita ayuda, pero puede manejarse con pequeña asistencia
independente (entra y sale solo, vestirse y desvestirse, limpiarse)
major help (una o dos personas fuertes o entrenadas), can sit
minor help (supervision verbal o pequña ayuda fisica)
dependiente (si usa silla de ruedas precisa ser empujado
camina con ayuda de otra persona (verbal or fisica) > 50 metros
independente (pero puede usar cualquier ayuda, por ejemplo un baston) > 50 metros

AttributeDefinition.description: Deja de tomar alguna vez los medicamentos para tratar su enfermedad
Toma los medicamentos a las horas indicadas
Cuando se encuentra bien, deja de tomar la medicación
Si alguna vez le sienta mal, deja usted de tomar la medicacion
en general, usted diria que su salud es
como diria que es su salud actual, comparada con la de hace un año
Esfuerzos intensos (correr, levantar objetos pesados o participar en deportes agotadores
Esfuerzos moderados (mover una mesa, pasar la aspiradora, cminar mas de una hora)
coger o llevar la bolsa de compra
subir varios pisos por la escalera
subir un solo piso por la escalera
bañarse o vestirse por si mismo
Reducir el tiempo dedicado al trabajo o actividades cotidianas a causa de salud fisica
Hizo menos de lo que hubiera querido hacer a causa de salud fisica
dejar de hacer algunas tareas en su trabajo o actividades cotidianas a causa de salud fisica
dificultad para hacer su trabajo o actividades cotidianas a causa de salud fisica
Reducir el tiempo dedicado al trabajo o actividades cotidianas a causa de algun problema emocional
Hizo menos de lo que hubiera querido hacer a causa de algun problema emocional
hizo su trabajo menos cuidadadosamente que de costumbre a causa de algun problema emocional
Dificultad en actividades sociales con familia, amigos, vecino u otros a causa de problemas fisicos o emocionales
Dolor en alguna parte del cuerpo
Hasta que punto el dolor le ha dificultado en su trabajo habitual (fuera de casa y tareas domesticas)
se sintio tan bajo de moral que nada podia animarle
con que frecuencia la salud fisica o los problemas emocionales le han dificultado sus actividades sociales
creo que me pongo enfermo mas facilmente que otras personas
creo que mi salud va a empeorar
revisión del plan de tratamiento, incluidas curaciones y administración de tratamiento intravenoso si se prescribe
refuerzo de la educación y adhesión terapéutica
comprobación del equipo instalado en el domicilio del paciente
evaluación del estado clínico del paciente
revisión del plan de tratamiento, incluidas curaciones y tratamiento intravenoso

DerivedAttributeDefinition.expression: number(ch1,0) + number(ch2,0) + number(ch3,0) + number(ch4,0) + number(ch5,0) + number(ch6,0) + number(ch7,0) + number(ch8,0) + number(ch9,0) + number(ch10,0) + number(ch11,0)*2 + number(ch12,0)*2 + number(ch13,0)*2 + number(ch14,0)*2 + number(ch15,0)*2 + number(ch16,0)*2 + number(ch17,0)*3 + number(ch18,0)*6 + number(ch19,0)*6 + number(ch20,0)

AttributeDefinition.description: Kan patiënt zonder enige hulp van iemand anders zelfstandig deze taak uitvoeren? - Boodschappen doen?
Kan patiënt zonder enige hulp van iemand anders zelfstandig deze taak uitvoeren? Buitenshuis rondlopen?
Kan patiënt zonder enige hulp van iemand anders zelfstandig deze taak uitvoeren? - Aan - en uitkleden?
Kan patiënt zonder enige hulp van iemand anders zelfstandig deze taak uitvoeren? Toiletbezoek?
Ondervindt patiënt problemen in het dagelijks leven door slecht zien?
Ondervindt patiënt problemen in het dagelijks leven door slecht horen?
Is patiënt afgelopen 6 maanden veel (6kg) afgevallen zonder dit zelf te willen? (of 3 kg in een maand)
Gebruikt patiënt momenteel 4 of meer verschillende soorten medicijnen?
Heeft patiënt momenteel klachten over zijn geheugen (of bekend met dementie)?
Ervaart patiënt wel eens een leegte om zich heen?
Mist patiënt wel eens mensen om zich heen?
Voelt patiënt zich wel eens in de steek gelaten?
Heeft patiënt zich de laatste tijd somber of neerslachtig gevoeld?
Heeft patiënt zich de laatste tijd nerveus of angstig gevoeld?
Welk rapportcijfer geeft patiënt zichzelf voor lichamelijke fitheid? (0-10, 0 is erg slecht, 10 is erg goed).

DerivedAttributeDefinition.expression: number(gfi1,0) + number(gfi2,0) + number(gfi3,0) + number(gfi4,0) + number(gfi5,0) + number(gfi6,0) + number(gfi7,0) + number(gfi8,0) + number(gfi9,0) + number(gfi10,0) + number(gfi11,0) + number(gfi12,0) + number(gfi13,0) + number(gfi14,0) + number(gfi15,0)

EnumerationOption.description: Needs help with more than 1 body part
Does the dressing without help, also buttons shirt and ties shoe laces
Needs help to button shirt and to tie shoe laces
Does not go to the toilet, uses cathether etc.
Transfers from the bed and back without any help
Transfers from the bed and back with help
Incontinent (or needs to be given enemas)
Needs help cutting, spreading butter etc. or requires modified diet
Needs help with eating, or receives enteral feeding

DerivedAttributeDefinition.expression: number(adl1,0) + number(adl2,0) + number(adl2,0) + number(adl3,0) + number(adl4,0) + number(adl5,0) + number(adl6,0)

EnumerationOption.description: Uses the telephone, dials the numbers without help
Answers the phone, but does not call
Is not able to do groceries
Is able to cook and serve
Cooks dinner, but ingredients are delivered
Heatens meals, but diet is insufficient
Does light tasks in the household independent
Does light tasks independent, but is not able to maintain the household
All laundry is done by others
Travels by car or public transport without help
Organizes taxi but does not travel with public transport
Travels by taxi, by car with help, or does not travel
Takes medication if prepared by someone
Is not able to bear responsibility for medication
Is able to handle own finances
Is not able to deal with money

Workspace.EntityDefinition:
<AttributeDefinition id="nrs1" type="enumeration" multiplicity="maximalOne" description="Is BMI <20,5?">
<EnumerationOption value="3" description="Weightloss > 5% in 1 month (> 15% in 3 months) or BMI < 18.5 + impaired general condition or food intake 0-25% of normal requirement."/>
<EnumerationOption value="0" description="< 70 years"/>

AttributeDefinition.description: Has food intake declined over the past 3 months due to loss of appetite, digestive problems, chewing or swallowingen difficulties?
Weight loss during the last 3 months

EnumerationOption.description: Able to get out of bed / chair but does not go out

AttributeDefinition.description: Has suffered psychological stress or acute disease in the past 3 months

DerivedAttributeDefinition.expression: number(mnasf1,0) + number(mnasf2,0) + number(mnasf3,0) + number(mnasf4,0) + number(mnasf5,0) + mnasf6 + mnasf7 + number(mnasf8,0)

AttributeDefinition.description: Length of Stay (including day of admission and discharge)
Was the patient admitted to hospital via the emergency department?
Conditions - Diabetes with end organ damage
Conditions – Mild liver or renal disease
Conditions – Any tumor (including lymphoma or leukemia)
Conditions – Moderate or severe liver or renal disease
Emergency department visits (six months prior to admission)

EnumerationOption.description: needs help cutting, spreading butter, etc., or requires modified diet
needs to help with personal care
needs help but can do about half unaided
incontinent (or needs to be given enemas)
incontinent, or catheterized and unable to manage alone
needs some help, but can do something alone
major help (one or two people, physical), can sit

AttributeDefinition.description: Minutes of low level activity daily
Minutes of medium level activity daily
Minutes of high level activity daily
Max minutes without activity allowed daily
Measure name, the posible values are
Frecuency Unit, the posiible values are
Frecuency Unit, the posiible values are
Slot to take the measurements, the possible values are
1. In general, would you say your health is:

The following questions are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health now limit you in these activities? If so, how much? 2. Moderate activities such as moving a table, pushing a vacuum cleaner, bowling, or playing golf.
The following questions are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health now limit you in these activities? If so, how much? 3. Climbing several flights of stairs.
During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health? 4. Accomplished less than you would like.

During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health? 5. Were limited in the kind of work or other activities.

During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious)? 6. Accomplished less than you would like.

During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious)? 7. Did work or activities less carefully than usual.

During the past 4 weeks, have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious)? 8. During the past 4 weeks, how much did pain interfere with your normal work (including work outside the home and housework)?

These questions are about how you have been feeling during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past 4 weeks... 9. Have you felt calm and peaceful?

EnumerationOption.description: A good bit of the time

AttributeDefinition.description: These questions are about how you have been feeling during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past 4 weeks... 10. Did you have a lot of energy?

EnumerationOption.description: A good bit of the time

AttributeDefinition.description: These questions are about how you have been feeling during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past 4 weeks... 11. Have you felt down-hearted and blue?

EnumerationOption.description: A good bit of the time

AttributeDefinition.description: These questions are about how you have been feeling during the past 4 weeks. For each question, please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past 4 weeks... 12. During the past 4 weeks, how much of the time has your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your social activities (like visiting friends, relatives, etc.)?
